titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Medical Manuscripts Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Diane E. Kaplan and Carol King

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday April 11, 2019 at 07:22

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: This artificial collection is composed of correspondence, journals, account books, manuscripts, scrapbooks, and printed material relating to the study and practice of medicine, primarily in Connecticut and New York, primarily in the nineteenth century.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown, though much of the material in this collection is likely in the public domain. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Medical Manuscripts Collection (MS 346). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Yale University Medical Historical Library, 1980-1998.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged by name of manuscript creator.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This artificial collection is composed of correspondence, journals, account books, manuscripts, scrapbooks, and printed material relating to the study and practice of medicine, primarily in Connecticut and New York, primarily in the nineteenth century.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: TMS, notes of lectures in pathology and physiology probably given at Cornell University where Hitchins received his M.D. in 1938. 2v. ill. [Ithaca, N.Y.]

odd.head: General note
odd.p: "The Jackson Health Resort, pioneer in its field as seen by those who knew it well, being an account of the institution's fiftieth anniversary with records of the seventieth and the one hundredth...and a supplement." Dansville, N.Y., 357 p. (electrostatic copy), ill. Original photographs and electrostatic copies of advertisements, menus and other memorabilia pasted in.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Ms notebook, "Sketches, historical and genealogical of the Tully family. Including an account of their first settlement in America, collected from manuscripts in possession of individuals as late as the year 1808." [ca. 1808?], l v. with two letters sewn in: ALS from Arthur Fenner, 1666/67 Oct 27 (with pencilled transcript), 2 p., ALS from Abigail Lee, [17__].

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Two ms notebooks: "A review of Portus' intellectual science, commenced December 2, 1872," and medical case notes taken in Vienna and Heidelberg, winter 1881-1882. 2 v.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Correspondence, photographs, blue prints and memoranda related to an exhibition titled "Human Eggs and Ovarian Hormones" at the Century of Progress Exposition in Chicago, 1933, to which Allen was a contributor. Twenty-two photostats reproduce the display. 35 items.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Letters (typed copies) to his family in Colebrook, Conn., while Horrax was serving as a doctor in an army base hospital in France under Dr. Harvey Cushing. 1 v.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Two ms notebooks: (1) Notes and extracts from courses in chemical and anatomical sciences, delivered at Dartmouth College, Hanover, N.H., during 1809 by Dr. Nathan Smith. (2) Receipts, materia medica and miscellaneous medical notes, 2 v.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Documents relating to her service in the American Red Cross, as a member of the French and Serbian Commissions during World War I, August 1917 - March 1920. 4 items.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Twelve lessons on phrenology, for the year of 1904, 12 pts. (mimeographed).

did.unittitle: Scrapbook of newspaper clippings with anecdotes, medical remedies and accounts of medical curiosities. 1 v.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Six ms notebooks related to his medical studies. These include two notebooks with his notes for lectures on chemistry and physiology at Yale College (1901), a notebook describing the characteristic course of common diseases, and three sketch books with colored drawings of abnormal cells.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: TMS, "Recollections of fifty years. An autobiography." New Haven, Conn., 1947 3 v. With mounted photographs laid in. Also included is a ms tribute by Daphne S. Townsend, her correspondence relating to the autobiography (1953-1954) and a printed obituary from the Connecticut State Medical Journal.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Five ms notebooks containing notes on courses in pharmacology, mental diseases, obstetrics, physical diagnosis and physiology as taught at the Homeopathic Medical College in New York City.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Six ms notebooks, of which one is a volume of notes on lectures and clinics at Bellevue Medical College (1868-1869), three record medical lectures at the College of Physicians and Surgeons in New York City (ca.1870-1871) and two contain brief miscellaneous notes, largely on remedies (1868-1871).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Transferred to YRG-47-J, 1982 May 19.

Ms notebooks with lectures on surgery delivered at Yale College. 5 v., numbered 3, 4, 5, 6, 8. A number of the volumes contain notes on the subsequent dates that the lectures were delivered, the latest being 1837.
Contents: Box 11, v.3, 4; Box 12, v.5, 6, 8.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: 2.5 inches

Physician. Correspondence, writings and printed matter documenting his career as a specialist in dermatology and syphilogy. Included also is a list of his publication and a list prepared by him of the medical books in the 1742 library of Yale College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of materials transferred from the Medical Historical Library in 1982. It is composed almost entirely of bound volumes such as account books and notebooks from the practices of several doctors. The materials date from 1777 through 1945. Most of the records come from New England, though there are a few items from Civil War Virginia and from New York.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: See also: box 5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Transfer date from Medical Historical Library unknown. Accessioned in 1998 as part of processing room backlog.

did.unittitle: Correspondence relating to published works by Harvey Williams Cushing, primarily The Meningiomas , of which Eisenhardt was a co-author

Correspondence, research notes, and writings, dating from the time when Light served as a fellow in the Laboratory of Surgical Research at the Harvard University Medical School and worked with Harvey Williams Cushing
Prospectus for internship applicants containing information on and photographs of City Hospital
